sections.heading: Beyond the Compass
sections.content: Circles have magical properties when you start drawing lines inside them. In S4, we look at the relationship between chords, tangents, and radii.

sections.heading: 1. Tangent-Radius Property
sections.content: A tangent is a line that touches the circle at exactly one point. The golden rule: A tangent meets the radius at $90^\circ$.

sections.heading: 2. Isosceles Triangles in Circles
sections.content: If you draw two radii from the center to the edge, they form an Isosceles triangle because both sides are length $r$. This means the base angles are equal.
